actor_awards.notes: An icon of the 'Swinging Sixties', she won the Academy Award for Best Actress for 'Darling' (1965). She is also known for her role as Lara in 'Doctor Zhivago' and her frequent collaborations with actor Warren Beatty.

filmography.title: Darling
filmography.role_description: A beautiful but amoral model who sleeps her way to the top of the London social scene, finding emptiness at the summit.
filmography.plot: A young model rises from obscurity to become a rich and famous socialite, but discovers that her lifestyle is unfulfilling.

filmography.title: Doctor Zhivago
filmography.role_description: The beautiful and tragic muse who captures the heart of the titular doctor amidst the Russian Revolution.
filmography.plot: The life of a Russian physician and poet who, although married to another, falls in love with a political activist's wife and experiences hardship during the First World War and then the October Revolution.

filmography.title: McCabe & Mrs. Miller
filmography.role_description: A tough, opium-addicted cockney madam who partners with a gambler to run a brothel in a frontier mining town.
filmography.plot: A gambler and a prostitute become business partners in a remote Old West mining town, and their enterprise thrives until a large corporation arrives on the scene.

filmography.title: Away from Her
filmography.role_description: A woman suffering from Alzheimer's disease who voluntarily enters a nursing home and forgets her husband.
filmography.plot: A man coping with the institutionalization of his wife because of Alzheimer's disease faces an epiphany when she transfers her affections to another man.

filmography.title: Don't Look Now
filmography.role_description: A grieving mother who travels to Venice with her husband and encounters two sisters who claim to see her deceased daughter.
filmography.plot: A married couple grieving the recent death of their young daughter are in Venice when they encounter two elderly sisters, one of whom is psychic and brings a warning from beyond.

filmography.title: Billy Liar
filmography.role_description: A free-spirited young woman who offers the protagonist a chance to escape his mundane life.
filmography.plot: A lazy, irresponsible young clerk in provincial Northern England lives in his own fantasy world and makes a decision about his future.

filmography.title: Afterglow
filmography.role_description: A former B-movie actress in an unhappy marriage who finds a connection with a younger man.
filmography.plot: Two families are unhappy with their respective relationships: a handyman and his wife, and a career-obsessed couple who hire him.

filmography.title: Fahrenheit 451
filmography.role_description: Christie plays dual roles as the fireman's conformity-loving wife and the free-thinking neighbor who questions society.
filmography.plot: In an oppressive future, a 'fireman' whose duty is to destroy all books begins to question his task.

filmography.title: Far from the Madding Crowd
filmography.role_description: A headstrong and independent Victorian woman who inherits a farm and attracts three very different suitors.
filmography.plot: Bathsheba Everdene, a willful, flirtatious, young woman, unexpectedly inherits a large farm and is romantically pursued by three very different men.

filmography.title: The Go-Between
filmography.role_description: An aristocratic woman engaging in a forbidden affair with a tenant farmer, using a young boy to carry messages.
filmography.plot: In 1900 Norfolk, a young boy staying with a wealthy family becomes the messenger for a secret love affair between the daughter of the house and a farmer.

filmography.title: Shampoo
filmography.role_description: The mistress of a wealthy businessman and the former lover of the protagonist, a Beverly Hills hairdresser.
filmography.plot: A hairdresser carrying on affairs with several women tries to get a bank loan to open his own shop on the eve of the 1968 presidential election.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nomination – Best Actress in a Motion Picture - Musical or Comedy

filmography.title: Petulia
filmography.role_description: A spirited but deeply unhappy newlywed who impulsively pursues a divorced doctor.
filmography.plot: A free-spirited socialite begins a romance with a strait-laced doctor, changing both their lives.

filmography.title: Heaven Can Wait
filmography.role_description: An environmental activist who falls in love with a quarterback reincarnated in the body of a millionaire.
filmography.plot: A Los Angeles Rams quarterback, accidentally taken away by an overanxious angel before he was meant to die, returns to life in the body of a recently murdered millionaire.

filmography.title: Finding Neverland
filmography.role_description: The stern and protective mother of Sylvia Llewelyn Davies, who disapproves of J.M. Barrie.
filmography.plot: The story of J.M. Barrie's friendship with a family who inspired him to create Peter Pan.

filmography.title: Heat and Dust
filmography.role_description: A modern woman investigating the scandalous history of her great-aunt in India.
filmography.plot: An English woman travels to India to uncover the truth about her great-aunt's notorious affair with an Indian prince in the 1920s.

filmography.title: Hamlet
filmography.role_description: The Queen of Denmark and mother of Hamlet in Kenneth Branagh's full-text adaptation.
filmography.plot: Hamlet, Prince of Denmark, returns home to find his father murdered and his mother remarried to the murderer, his uncle.

filmography.title: Demon Seed
filmography.role_description: A woman imprisoned in her own home by an advanced artificial intelligence that wants to impregnate her.
filmography.plot: A scientist creates Proteus, an organic super computer with artificial intelligence which becomes obsessed with human beings, and in particular the creator's wife.

filmography.title: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
filmography.role_description: The landlady of the Three Broomsticks pub in Hogsmeade.
filmography.plot: Harry Potter, Ron and Hermione return to Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry for their third year of study, where they delve into the mystery surrounding an escaped prisoner who poses a dangerous threat to the young wizard.

filmography.title: Troy
filmography.role_description: The mother of Achilles who prophesies his fate in the Trojan War.
filmography.plot: An adaptation of Homer's great epic, the film follows the assault on Troy by the united Greek forces and chronicles the fates of the men involved.

filmography.title: The Return of the Soldier
filmography.role_description: The snobbish wife of a shell-shocked WWI soldier who only remembers an old love.
filmography.plot: A soldier returns home from the First World War suffering from amnesia, remembering only a working-class woman he loved twenty years before.

filmography.title: Dragonheart
filmography.role_description: The mother of the tyrannical King Einon who tries to protect her people.
filmography.plot: The last dragon and a disillusioned dragonslaying knight must cooperate to stop an evil king, who was given partial immortality.

filmography.title: The Company You Keep
filmography.role_description: A former Weather Underground activist still living on the run.
filmography.plot: A former Weather Underground activist goes on the run from a journalist who has discovered his identity.

filmography.title: Red Riding Hood
filmography.role_description: The mysterious grandmother of the protagonist in this dark fantasy retelling.
filmography.plot: Set in a medieval village that is haunted by a werewolf, a young girl falls for an orphaned woodcutter, much to her family's displeasure.

filmography.title: The Secret Life of Words
filmography.role_description: A counselor who helps the protagonist confront her traumatic past.
filmography.plot: A hearing-impaired woman who tries to forget her past is forced to confront it when she cares for a man on an oil rig who has been temporarily blinded.

filmography.title: Glorious 39
filmography.role_description: The formidable aunt in a family drama set on the eve of World War II.
filmography.plot: In 1939, a British family's idyllic life begins to unravel as the threat of war with Germany looms.

filmography.title: Young Cassidy
filmography.role_description: A chorus girl and early love interest of the Irish playwright protagonist.
filmography.plot: A biopic of Irish playwright Sean O'Casey, depicting his life in Dublin during the early 20th century.

filmography.title: Power
filmography.role_description: A journalist and the ex-wife of a political consultant.
filmography.plot: A ruthless political consultant's life unravels when he is forced to confront his own ethics and the corruption of his clients.
